Record Class Rectangle2f

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.Rectangle2f
Record Components:
x - the x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle
y - the y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle
width - the width of the rectangle (must be >= 0)
height - the height of the rectangle (must be >= 0)
public record Rectangle2f(float x, float y, float width, float height) extends Record
Immutable rectangle with float coordinates.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Rectangle2f
    addMargin(float m)
    Adds a margin to the current rectangle, i.e., create a rectangle with the same center as this rectangle but with borders pushed out by the amount given by m.

    Adds a margin to the current rectangle, i.e., create a rectangle with the same center as this rectangle but with borders pushed out by the amount given by mx and my.

    Adds a margin to the current rectangle, creating a new rectangle with the same center as this rectangle but with borders pushed out by the specified margins.

      public static Rectangle2f of(float x, float y, float w, float h)

      x - the x-coordinate
      y - the y-coordinate
      w - the width
      h - the height
      Returns:
      rectangle

    • translate

      public Rectangle2f translate(float dx, float dy)
      Translates the rectangle by the specified amounts in the x and y directions.
      Parameters:
      dx - the amount to translate along the x-direction
      dy - the amount to translate along the y-direction
      Returns:
      a rectangle that is translated by dx and dy

      Translates the rectangle by the specified amounts in the x and y directions.
      Parameters:
      t - the translation vector
      Returns:
      a rectangle that is translated by t

    • addMargin

      public Rectangle2f addMargin(float mx, float my)
      Adds a margin to the current rectangle, i.e., create a rectangle with the same center as this rectangle but with borders pushed out by the amount given by mx and my. Use negative values to shrink the rectangle.
      Parameters:
      mx - the amount to the margin to apply to the x-coordinates
      my - the amount to the margin to apply to the y-coordinates
      Returns:
      a new Rectangle2f instance with the added margin

    • addMargin

      public Rectangle2f addMargin(float m)
      Adds a margin to the current rectangle, i.e., create a rectangle with the same center as this rectangle but with borders pushed out by the amount given by m. Use negative values to shrink the rectangle.
      Parameters:
      m - the amount to subtract the margin to add
      Returns:
      a new Rectangle2f instance with the added margin

    • addMargin

      public Rectangle2f addMargin(float mLeft, float mTop, float mRight, float mBottom)
      Adds a margin to the current rectangle, creating a new rectangle with the same center as this rectangle but with borders pushed out by the specified margins. Use negative values to shrink the rectangle.
      Parameters:
      mLeft - the margin to be applied to the left side of the rectangle
      mTop - the margin to be applied to the top side of the rectangle
      mRight - the margin to be applied to the right side of the rectangle
      mBottom - the margin to be applied to the bottom side of the rectangle
      Returns:
      a new Rectangle2f instance with the added margin

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Vector2f p)
      Determines if the specified point is contained within the rectangle.
      Parameters:
      p - the point to check, represented as a Vector2f
      Returns:
      true if the rectangle contains the point, otherwise false

    • intersects

      public boolean intersects(Rectangle2f r)
      Determines whether this rectangle intersects with the specified rectangle.
      Parameters:
      r - the rectangle to check for intersection
      Returns:
      true if this rectangle intersects with the specified rectangle, otherwise false

    • moveTo

      public Rectangle2f moveTo(float x, float y)
      Creates a new rectangle by moving the top-left corner to the specified coordinates while preserving the current width and height.
      Parameters:
      x - the new x-coordinate for the top-left corner of the rectangle
      y - the new y-coordinate for the top-left corner of the rectangle
      Returns:
      a new Rectangle2f instance with the updated position

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with the compare method from their corresponding wrapper classes.
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:

      Returns:
